title: SQL ServerUNICODE()Function

metadata.description: Learn about SQL ServerUNICODE()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return an integer value (the Unicode value), for the first character of the 
input expression:
SELECT UNICODE('Atlanta');

Definition and Usage
The UNICODE() function returns an integer value (the Unicode value), for the first character of the input expression.
Syntax
UNICODE(
character_expression
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
character_expression
Required. An nchar or varchar expression
Technical Details
Works in:
SQL Server (starting with 2008), Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Data 
  Warehouse, Parallel Data Warehouse
More Examples
Example
Return an integer value (the Unicode value), for the first character of the 
input expression:
SELECT UNICODE(CustomerName) AS UnicodeOfFirstChar
FROM Customers;

❯
★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
SELECT UNICODE(CustomerName) AS UnicodeOfFirstChar
FROM Customers;

summary: This tutorial covers SQL ServerUNICODE()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use SQL ServerUNICODE()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of SQL ServerUNICODE()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
